author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Delhi Police on Sunday said they had clear leads about callers who had threatened CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury over the past few days and would soon track them down.

Deputy Commissioner of Police Jatin Narwal said the police had identified some numbers and those who had registered them.

Mr. Yechury said the callers had been abusing him and threatening to harm him after falsely accusing him of making derogatory remarks against Goddess Durga. “ The fact remains that I was responding to the speech made by the HRD Minister in Parliament and have not said anything about the goddess,” he said.
title: Yechury gets threatening calls
